page.title: 10Real Ice Cream, Bowness.
page.content: {Real ice cream}can only be produced on a small scale. It involves labour intensive fruit preparation using expensive ingredients such as{butter, {fruit,double cream,}and{syrups}of the correct sugar density.To produce such {real ice creams}for hotels also requires an expensive machine to churn the mix. It is also necessary to register with the{Local Environmental {Health Officer.}Once the ice cream has been made it must be stored in a deep freeze (which adds to the expense). When it is ordered by the customers it has to be distributed. Because of the good ingredients real ice cream costs {3-4 times}the price of{'commercial' ice cream but when you have tried it,you will never want to go back to the mass produced product.
